title: 30 Day Chart Challenge
text:
This website showcases my participation in the 30 Day Chart Challenge.
The #30DayChartChallenge is a data visualization event where participants create and share one chart per day throughout the month of April, each inspired by a specific daily theme and prompt. It’s a creative way to explore data, experiment with visual storytelling, and improve charting skills.
Check out the challenge details on the official GitHub page.
You can find all the code, data, and individual plots in my GitHub repository.
Feel free to explore the charts by week and day using the navigation menu above!

title: 30 Day Chart Challenge
text:
I am Natasa and I am a Computational scientist / Bioinformatician, working at Institute of Applied Biosciences (INAB) situated within the Centre for Research & Technology, Hellas (CERTH).
I received my B.Sc. in Biochemistry and Biotechnology from the University of Thessaly where i completed my thesis entitle “Study of genetic variations in patients with haematological malignancies” in collaboration with INAB. Subsequently, i obtained a M.Sc. in Translational Research in Biomedicine from the Democritus University of Thrace. During my master’s thesis titled ‘Characterization of TP53 gene mutations in patients with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia,’ i became interested in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology.
Currently, my main focus is on analyzing and visualizing Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) data, aiming to extract meaningful biological insights. I am also experienced in creating interactive web applications and websites, making data exploration and visualization more accessible and user-friendly for researchers.
You can explore some of my work in my Visual Portfolio.
